newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian stocks end unchanged in moribund trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian stocks end unchanged in moribund trade.

text.p: ** (1230 GMT) - Indian blue chips end little changed in
dull trade
** Bombay share index down 4.23 points at 3,730.78
** Tobacco conglomerate ITC gains 4.75 rupees at 424.25
amid heavy volumes on technical correction
** Delhi share index down 0.28 pts at 770.48, National
exchange index falls 4.80 pts at 1,037.20
** Market activity focussed on select stocks, lack of
investment buying seen as fears of hike in
government-set oil prices remain, traders say
Indian stocks drifted in range-bound trade on Thursday, with lack of market moving news affecting prices, dealers said.
"Unloading by bull operators along with lack of investment buying due to poor company results affected market sentiment," said Pradip Doshi, a member-broker of the Bombay Stock Exchange.
Most of the front-bencher stocks showed little change amid thin volumes ahead of the last day of weekly settlement at the Bombay Exchange on Friday, dealers said.
Dealers said business was affected due to the closure of major local investment institutions for a local holiday.
Indian money markets were largely inactive due to a bank holiday.
"It's a very quiet day. Many dealing rooms wore an empty look," said an equities dealer at a domestic brokerage.
Tata Iron & Steel Company Ltd (TISCO) ended 0.50 rupees down at 177.75 ahead of its 1996/97 (March-April) annual results.
"I don't see profits rising," said Hozefa Topiwalla, steel analyst at Bombay brokerage firm First Global Finance. "Profits will be flat...there might be a minor downside."
The profits of India's private steel maker are seen flat-to-lower in fiscal 1996/97 due to sluggish market and tight margins, analysts said.
"At the start of the year we had expected volume growth of 6-7 percent," said Aniruddha Dange, analyst at ICICI Securities and Finance Company (I-Sec).
"Margins were squeezed as it was not able to pass on higher costs to consumers," he said.
Dange forecast the net profit at 5.05 billion rupees against 5.67 billion in 1995/96..
-- Bombay equities desk +91-22-265 9000
